meanings.definition: To vomit or regurgitate food from the stomach.
meanings.sent1: After eating too quickly, he had to brecham in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The dog tends to brecham after eating grass.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster made him brecham his lunch, much to his embarrassment.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing emotions made her brecham out her feelings in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The bad sushi made him brecham uncontrollably, creating a mess.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nausea or discomfort in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: Her brecham was a sign that she shouldn't have eaten the expired yogurt.
meanings.sent2: The car ride on the winding road gave him a sudden brecham.
meanings.sent3: The combination of strange foods gave him a weird brecham that lingered all day.
meanings.sent4: The brecham of anxiety in her stomach felt like a storm brewing inside.
meanings.sent5: The brecham of fear before the presentation made her palms sweat.
